arm_group.description: custom made navigation technology integrated in a Siemens angiography suite for feasibility evaluation in endoleak repair procedure

brief_summary.textblock:
The study is aimed at investigating whether repair of endoleak type II can be improved by
      adding navigation technology. Can this technology increase precision by guiding the needle
      that punctures through the skin as used during the repair procedure? Can the procedure
      logistics be improved by using navigation technology instead of computed tomography (CT)
      guidance of the needle puncture? Parameters logged during the procedure:

        -  was the needle placement successful?

        -  number of needle punctures?

        -  time used on guidance procedure

        -  X-ray exposure dose

clinical_study.brief_title: Endoleak Repair Guided by Navigation Technology

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  detected endoleak

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  n/a

clinical_study.official_title: Endoleak Repair Guided by Navigation Technology

oversight_info.authority: Norway:National Committee for Medical and Health Research Ethics

primary_outcome.description: number of patients with persistent leakage

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
